warlockDemon.flavor: Everyone expects an inquisition reference.
warlockDemon.name: Felsoul Inquisitor
warlockDemon.text: Lifesteal Taunt

warlockDemon.flavor: She rids villages of annoying pests, like rats and children.
warlockDemon.name: Witchwood Piper
warlockDemon.text: [x]Battlecry: Draw the lowest Cost minion from your deck.

warlockDemon.flavor: He was super excited to acquire Gorehowl at a garage sale!  Then super disappointed to find out it was a foam reproduction.
warlockDemon.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
warlockDemon.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
warlockDemon.name: Prince Malchezaar
warlockDemon.text: [x]Start of Game: Add 5 extra Legendary minions to your deck.

warlockDemon.flavor: You had to put the portable hole inside the bag of holding, didn't you?!
warlockDemon.name: Void Ripper
warlockDemon.text: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of all other minions.

warlockDemon.flavor: Dreamed of becoming a Stylefiend, but fel was never in season.
warlockDemon.name: Vilefiend
warlockDemon.text: Lifesteal

warlockLifesteal.flavor: Photo actually taken across the street in the reflection of a doorknob.
warlockLifesteal.name: Enhanced Dreadlord

warlockLifesteal.flavor:
"Whether the Nether is cold,
whether the Nether is hot,
we'll burn together,
whatever the Nether,
whether we like it or not."
warlockLifesteal.name: Nether Breath
warlockLifesteal.text: Deal $2 damage. If you're holding a Dragon, deal $4 damage with Lifesteal instead.

warlockLifesteal.flavor: The itsy bitsy spiders climbed up the village wall. Then came the witch and the spiders ate them all.
warlockLifesteal.name: Deathweb Spider
warlockLifesteal.text: Battlecry: If your hero took damage this turn, gain Lifesteal.

warlockLifesteal.flavor: Her sister is the Queen of Pane who sells windows and shower doors.
warlockLifesteal.name: Queen of Pain

warlockLifesteal.flavor: Cleans even the toughest clogs with just a flick of the wrist!
warlockLifesteal.name: Drain Soul

warlockLifesteal.flavor: As a young blood-princess she learned the proper way for a lady to curtsy, how to address fellow members of royalty, and how to bite them.
warlockLifesteal.name: Blood-Queen Lana'thel
warlockLifesteal.text: [x]Lifesteal Has +1 Attack for each card you've discarded this game.

warlockLifesteal.flavor:
A purple stone Azari carved
For dark hearts, craving, power-starved.
The first to bow, the warlock Rin,
Embraced the darkness, slew her kin.
warlockLifesteal.name: Lesser Amethyst Spellstone
warlockLifesteal.text: Lifesteal. Deal $3 damage to a minion. (Take damage from your cards to upgrade.)

warlockLifesteal.flavor: If you love Jeklik, set her free. YOU CAN'T GET RID OF HER.
warlockLifesteal.name: High Priestess Jeklik
warlockLifesteal.text: [x]Taunt, Lifesteal When you discard this, add 2 copies of it to your hand.

warlockLifesteal.flavor: Everything but the kitchen sink. Oh wait, there's one on his back.
warlockLifesteal.name: Zilliax

warlockLifesteal.flavor: They make wonderful pets if you're not allergic to blood loss.
warlockLifesteal.name: Vicious Scalehide
Pumpkin Peasant
warlockLifesteal.text: [x]Lifesteal Each turn this is in your hand, swap its Attack and Health.

warlockLifesteal.flavor: A face only a druid could love.
warlockLifesteal.name: Swamp Leech

warlockLifesteal.flavor: "1 minion… ah, ah, ah! 2 minions… ah, ah, ah! 3 minions… ah, ah, ah!"
warlockLifesteal.name: Countess Ashmore
warlockLifesteal.text: [x]Battlecry: Draw a Rush, Lifesteal, and Deathrattle card from your deck.

warlockLifesteal.flavor: Three Princes stand before you. This one devours one after another.
warlockLifesteal.name: Prince Valanar
warlockLifesteal.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no 4-Cost cards, gain Lifesteal and Taunt.

warlockLifesteal.flavor: Queen Lana'thel insists on one of these, fried, every morning for breakfast.
warlockLifesteal.name: Bloodworm

warlockLifesteal.flavor: Her extensive collection of corpses includes one of nearly every type.  She'd love for you to join it.
warlockLifesteal.name: Corpsetaker
warlockLifesteal.text: [x]Battlecry: Gain Taunt if your deck has a Taunt minion. Repeat for Divine Shield, Lifesteal, Windfury.

warlockLifesteal.flavor: Famed hunter of the deadly Achilliosaur.
warlockLifesteal.name: Cheaty Anklebiter

warlockLifesteal.flavor: Dreamed of becoming a Stylefiend, but fel was never in season.
warlockLifesteal.name: Vilefiend

warlockDestroy.flavor: There's a fine line between "potion" and "grenade". Wait. Actually, there's not.
warlockDestroy.name: Blastcrystal Potion
warlockDestroy.text: Destroy a minion and one of your Mana Crystals.

warlockDestroy.flavor: You do not want to be on the business end of this intellect!
warlockDestroy.name: EVIL Genius
warlockDestroy.text: Battlecry: Destroy a friendly minion to add 2 random Lackeys to your hand.

warlockDestroy.name: Void Terror
warlockDestroy.text: [x]Battlecry: Destroy both adjacent minions and gain their Attack and Health.

warlockDestroy.flavor: You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul.  You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.
warlockDestroy.name: Siphon Soul
warlockDestroy.text: Destroy a minion. Restore #3 Health to your hero.

warlockDestroy.flavor: He's on the hunt for Togwaggle's missing rat.
warlockDestroy.name: Ratcatcher
warlockDestroy.text: Rush Battlecry: Destroy a friendly minion and gain its Attack and Health.

warlockDestroy.flavor: Have some! This drink is to die for!
warlockDestroy.name: Sanguine Reveler
warlockDestroy.text: Battlecry: Destroy a friendly minion and gain +2/+2.

warlockDestroy.flavor: We ran out of space for "DOOOOOOOOOOOM!!!!!"
warlockDestroy.name: DOOM!
warlockDestroy.text: Destroy all minions. Draw a card for each.

warlockDestroy.flavor: Brings you face to face with your destructive impulses.
warlockDestroy.name: Riftcleaver
warlockDestroy.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion. Your hero takes damage equal to its Health.

warlockDestroy.flavor: This is fine.
warlockDestroy.name: Plague of Flames
warlockDestroy.text:
[x]Destroy all your minions.
For each one, destroy a
random enemy minion.

warlockDestroy.flavor: The most terrifying of Un’goro magics is both silent… AND deadly.
warlockDestroy.name: Corrupting Mist
warlockDestroy.text: Corrupt every minion. Destroy them at the start of your next turn.

warlockDestroy.flavor: Rend believes he is the True Warchief of the Horde and he keeps editing the wikipedia page for "Warchief of the Horde" to include his picture.
warlockDestroy.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
warlockDestroy.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
warlockDestroy.name: Rend Blackhand
warlockDestroy.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, destroy a Legendary minion.

warlockDestroy.flavor: "You’re fine, friendly minions! You're fine! Don’t tell Mom!"
warlockDestroy.name: Teron Gorefiend
warlockDestroy.text: Battlecry: Destroy all friendly minions. Deathrattle: Resummon them with +1/+1.

warlockDestroy.flavor: Oozes love Flamenco.  Don't ask.
warlockDestroy.name: Acidic Swamp Ooze
warlockDestroy.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon.

warlockDestroy.flavor: “That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!”
warlockDestroy.name: Harrison Jones
warlockDestroy.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and draw cards equal to its Durability.

warlockDestroy.flavor: "Aww, I love it! It even kinda looks like me."
warlockDestroy.name: Voodoo Doll
warlockDestroy.text: Battlecry: Choose a minion. Deathrattle: Destroy the chosen minion.

warlockDestroy.flavor: Empty your pockets, I know you’ve got a Wandering Monster in there!
warlockDestroy.name: Chief Inspector
warlockDestroy.text: Battlecry: Destroy all enemy Secrets.

warlockDestroy.flavor: His favorites are classic tragedies like "The Hobbit" and "Grendel".
warlockDestroy.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
warlockDestroy.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
warlockDestroy.name: Book Wyrm
warlockDestroy.targetingArrowText: Destroy an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack.
warlockDestroy.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, destroy an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack.

warlockDestroy.flavor: Once a noble dragon known as Neltharion, Deathwing lost his mind and shattered Azeroth before finally being defeated.  Daddy issues?
warlockDestroy.name: Deathwing
warlockDestroy.text: Battlecry: Destroy all other minions and discard your hand.

warlockDestroy.flavor: This Kodo is so big that he can stampede by himself.
warlockDestroy.name: Stampeding Kodo
warlockDestroy.text: Battlecry: Destroy a random enemy minion with 2 or less Attack.

warlockDestroy.flavor: The goblin travel agency lost his luggage, but he's still having a great vacation!
warlockDestroy.name: Hemet, Jungle Hunter
warlockDestroy.text: Battlecry: Destroy all cards in your deck that cost (3) or less.

warlockLackey.flavor: You do not want to be on the business end of this intellect!
warlockLackey.name: EVIL Genius
warlockLackey.text: Battlecry: Destroy a friendly minion to add 2 random Lackeys to your hand.

warlockLackey.flavor: If you don't keep up with your payments, it'll be a repossessed lackey.
warlockLackey.name: Possessed Lackey

warlockLackey.flavor:
"So, what's in the sack?" 
"Something... sinister." 
"Okay, it's a deal."
warlockLackey.name: Sinister Deal

warlockLackey.flavor: I'm starting to think the lackeys aren't evil, just taken advantage of.
warlockLackey.name: EVIL Recruiter
warlockLackey.text: Battlecry: Destroy a friendly Lackey to summon a 5/5 Demon.

warlockLackey.flavor: He'll get that League of Explorers and their little murloc too!
warlockLackey.name: Dark Pharaoh Tekahn
warlockLackey.text: Battlecry: For the rest of the game, your Lackeys are 4/4.

warlockLackey.flavor: Gradually driven to darkness by the promise of unobtainable cheese.
warlockLackey.name: EVIL Cable Rat

warlockLackey.flavor: Esteemed leader of Rafaam's Inhuman Resources department.
warlockLackey.name: Grand Lackey Erkh
warlockLackey.text: After you play a Lackey, add a Lackey to your hand.

paladinDivineShield.flavor: We call it the bubble machine.
paladinDivineShield.name: Autodefense Matrix
paladinDivineShield.text: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, give it Divine Shield.

paladinDivineShield.flavor: "Think you got lethal? Libram of NOPE!"
paladinDivineShield.name: Libram of Hope
paladinDivineShield.text: Restore 8 Health. Summon an 8/8 Guardian with Taunt and Divine Shield.

paladinDivineShield.flavor: Wickerflame spent years as a recruit for the Goons, never making the big-time because he always fired his chest-cannon too slowly.  "Hey," he thought, "maybe if I keep my beard lit on fire, I can do this faster."  BOOM, promoted.
paladinDivineShield.name: Wickerflame Burnbristle

paladinDivineShield.flavor: Shield yourself in righteousness! It feels like a warm fuzzy blanket.
paladinDivineShield.name: Righteousness

paladinDivineShield.flavor: If you haven't heard the Tirion Fordring theme song, it's because it doesn't exist.
paladinDivineShield.name: Tirion Fordring

paladinDivineShield.flavor: She seems scary, but she's got a glass jaw.
paladinDivineShield.name: The Glass Knight
paladinDivineShield.text: [x]Divine Shield Whenever you restore Health, gain Divine Shield.

paladinDivineShield.flavor: Guardians used to be built out of Adamantium, but production got moved to Gadgetzan and Cobalt was cheap.
paladinDivineShield.name: Cobalt Guardian
paladinDivineShield.text: Whenever you summon a Mech, gain Divine Shield.

paladinDivineShield.flavor: He's so hot right now.
paladinDivineShield.name: Bolvar, Fireblood
paladinDivineShield.text: Divine Shield After a friendly minion loses Divine Shield, gain +2 Attack.

paladinDivineShield.flavor: Standard issue recruit gear: 1 silver sword, 1 Lordaeron insignia, 2 bags of crystal kibble.
paladinDivineShield.name: Crystal Lion
paladinDivineShield.text: [x]Divine Shield Costs (1) less for each Silver Hand Recruit you control.

paladinDivineShield.flavor: … Arrives? Approaches? TELL US ALREADY!
paladinDivineShield.name: A New Challenger...
paladinDivineShield.text: Discover a 6-Cost minion. Summon it with Taunt and Divine Shield.

paladinDivineShield.flavor: Needs just a few more ratings points to become Grandmaster Jouster.
paladinDivineShield.name: Master Jouster
paladinDivineShield.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Taunt and Divine Shield.

paladinDivineShield.flavor: Leave them alone for two minutes and they go right into sleep mode.
paladinDivineShield.name: Bull Dozer

paladinDivineShield.flavor: Everything but the kitchen sink. Oh wait, there's one on his back.
paladinDivineShield.name: Zilliax

paladinDivineShield.flavor: Some heroes have soft hearts and hard shells.
paladinDivineShield.name: Traveling Healer

paladinDivineShield.flavor: Stops for nothing—except donuts.
paladinDivineShield.name: Dalaran Crusader

paladinDivineShield.flavor: She doesn’t ACTUALLY walk on the Sun.  It's just a name.  Don’t worry!
paladinDivineShield.name: Sunwalker

paladinDivineShield.flavor: Takes double damage from wick-based weapons.
paladinDivineShield.name: Wax Elemental

paladinDivineShield.flavor: He is a champion, with no friends. He'll keep on fighting, til the end!
paladinDivineShield.name: Lone Champion
paladinDivineShield.text: Battlecry: If you control no other minions, gain Taunt and Divine Shield.

paladinDivineShield.flavor: "Annoyinger-o-Tron" was just too unwieldy. And accurate.
paladinDivineShield.name: Psych-o-Tron

paladinDivineShield.flavor: Strike him down, and you'll face the Colossus of the New Moon.
paladinDivineShield.name: Colossus of the Moon

paladinMech.flavor: When you need more iron in your diet.
paladinMech.name: Mechano-Egg

paladinMech.flavor: They tried for weeks to make a stealth version, but eventually decided to just let it glow.
paladinMech.name: Glow-Tron

paladinMech.flavor: Every ten seconds it asks if you want to update.
paladinMech.name: Annoy-o-Module

paladinMech.flavor:
"That's three, Kangor. Three isn't endless."
- Countess Ashmore
paladinMech.name: Kangor's Endless Army
paladinMech.text: Resurrect 3 friendly Mechs. They keep any Magnetic upgrades.

paladinMech.flavor: Carefully engineered to never grab the Mimiron plush toy.
paladinMech.name: Sky Claw
paladinMech.text: Your other Mechs have +1 Attack. Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Microcopters.

paladinMech.flavor: He chooses to believe what he is programmed to believe!
paladinMech.name: Shielded Minibot

paladinMech.flavor: Guardians used to be built out of Adamantium, but production got moved to Gadgetzan and Cobalt was cheap.
paladinMech.name: Cobalt Guardian
paladinMech.text: Whenever you summon a Mech, gain Divine Shield.

paladinMech.flavor: The dramatically detailed terrifically trimmed replica of the real thing!
paladinMech.name: Micro Mummy
paladinMech.text: [x]Reborn At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Attack.

paladinMech.flavor: It takes a lot to wind him up.
paladinMech.name: Clockwork Knight
Kaboom Bot
paladinMech.text: Deathrattle: Deal 4 damage to a random enemy minion.

paladinMech.name: Alarm-o-Bot
paladinMech.text:
[x]At the start of your turn,
swap this minion with a
   random one in your hand.

paladinMech.flavor: "Overheat threshold exceeded. System failure. Wheat clog in port two. Shutting down."
paladinMech.name: Harvest Golem

paladinMech.flavor: Most mechs are pretty chill, but this one is all wound up.
paladinMech.name: Clockwork Automaton
paladinMech.text: Double the damage and healing of your Hero Power.

paladinMech.flavor: How is this supposed to work? Your enemies think, "Hey! Cute sheep!" and run over to cuddle it?
paladinMech.name: Explosive Sheep

paladinMech.flavor: The engineering equivalent of a "Kick Me" sticker.
paladinMech.name: Target Dummy

paladinMech.flavor: Do not push the big red button!
paladinMech.name: Mimiron's Head
paladinMech.text: At the start of your turn, if you have at least 3 Mechs, destroy them all and form V-07-TR-0N.

paladinMech.flavor: "Annoyinger-o-Tron" was just too unwieldy. And accurate.
paladinMech.name: Psych-o-Tron

paladinReborn.flavor: No one knows whose ancestor he is, but he's still upset that you never call.
paladinReborn.name: Ancestral Guardian

paladinReborn.flavor: The dramatically detailed terrifically trimmed replica of the real thing!
paladinReborn.name: Micro Mummy
paladinReborn.text: [x]Reborn At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Attack.

paladinReborn.flavor: "I do say, this gives me the vapors every single time!"
paladinReborn.name: Making Mummies

paladinReborn.flavor: He's back. He's angry. And he's here to wrap things up.
paladinReborn.name: Temple Berserker

paladinReborn.flavor: Yeah, she's mummified, but her money hasn’t dried up!
paladinReborn.name: Generous Mummy

paladinReborn.flavor: The end result of one of the greatest wrap battles of all time.
paladinReborn.name: Wrapped Golem
paladinReborn.text: [x]Reborn At the end of your turn, summon a 1/1 Scarab with Taunt.

paladinReborn.flavor: They'll never see me coming, what with my glowing body, eyes and daggers.
paladinReborn.name: Wasteland Assassin

paladinReborn.flavor: It uses only the eco-friendly bones from free-range humanoids.
paladinReborn.name: Bone Wraith

paladinReborn.flavor: The ankle bone's connected to the shin bone. The knuckle bone's connected to the... eh, it'll be fine.
paladinReborn.name: Mortuary Machine
paladinReborn.text: After your opponent plays a minion, give it Reborn.

paladinReborn.flavor: Strike him down, and you'll face the Colossus of the New Moon.
paladinReborn.name: Colossus of the Moon

paladinReborn.flavor: Unlike other mummies, they rolled him up with rice, sliced cucumbers, and soy sauce on the side.
paladinReborn.name: Murmy

paladinSilver.flavor: He doesn't even get Sundays off.  Every day he's hostling.
paladinSilver.name: Warhorse Trainer
paladinSilver.text: Your Silver Hand Recruits have +1 Attack.

paladinSilver.flavor: Card-carrying member of the Paladins Only Paladin Club.
paladinSilver.name: Lightforged Zealot
paladinSilver.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no Neutral cards, equip a   4/2 Truesilver Champion.

paladinSilver.flavor: What's Millhouse Manastorm doing in Silvermoon?
paladinSilver.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
paladinSilver.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
paladinSilver.name: Silvermoon Portal
paladinSilver.text:
Give a minion +2/+2. Summon a random
2-Cost minion.

paladinSilver.name: Level Up!
paladinSilver.text: Give your Silver Hand Recruits +2/+2 and Taunt.

paladinSilver.name: Drygulch Jailor
paladinSilver.text: Deathrattle: Add 3 Silver Hand Recruits to your hand.

paladinSilver.flavor: Or if you're too tired, you can just kind of lean against the darkness.
paladinSilver.name: Stand Against Darkness

paladinSilver.flavor: George and Karl!  Thank the Light we found you!
paladinSilver.name: Vinecleaver
paladinSilver.text:
[x]After your hero attacks,
summon two 1/1 Silver
Hand Recruits.

paladinSilver.flavor: George and Karl were never heard from again.
paladinSilver.name: Lost in the Jungle

paladinSilver.flavor: “Come now, Johnston. I think those horns are quite fetching on you.”
paladinSilver.name: Lightfused Stegodon

paladinSilver.flavor: It's difficult to get an air raid together. You have to get twenty-five people, and they all want to play a paladin!
paladinSilver.name: Air Raid
paladinSilver.text: Twinspell Summon two 1/1 Silver Hand Recruits with Taunt.

paladinSilver.flavor: The Silver Hand is the best paladin organization.  The Argent Crusaders are super jealous.
paladinSilver.name: Silver Hand Regent

paladinSilver.flavor: He likes to act like he's in charge, but the silverback matriarch actually runs things.
paladinSilver.name: Silverback Patriarch

paladinSilver.flavor: It's good to be a knight.   Less so to be one's squire.
paladinSilver.name: Silver Hand Knight

paladinSilver.flavor: The first time they tried to guard Silvermoon against the scourge, it didn’t go so well…
paladinSilver.name: Silvermoon Guardian

paladinSilver.flavor: Float like a Faerie Dragon, sting like a Hivequeen.
paladinSilver.name: Silver Vanguard

paladinMurloc.flavor: Hee hee!  Look at his cute little feet.
paladinMurloc.name: Murloc Knight

paladinMurloc.flavor: Imprisoned for ten thousand years! Not because it's a demon. Because of the dancing.
paladinMurloc.name: Imprisoned Sungill
paladinMurloc.text: Dormant for 2 turns. When this awakens, summon two 1/1 Murlocs.

paladinMurloc.flavor: "I said I wanted the ASHbringer not FISHbringer!"
paladinMurloc.name: Underlight Angling Rod
paladinMurloc.text: After your Hero attacks, add a random Murloc to your hand.

paladinMurloc.flavor: Murlocs are not native to Outland. When the Sungills arrived, one among them rose to the challenge of this dark world. They call him... Murgurgle. Murgur Murgurgle.
paladinMurloc.name: Murgur Murgurgle
paladinMurloc.text: [x]Divine Shield Deathrattle: Shuffle 'Murgurgle Prime' into your deck.

paladinMurloc.flavor: Listen, see?  We'll take 'em to the docks, see?  And throw 'em in the sea, see?
paladinMurloc.name: Grimscale Chum
paladinMurloc.text: [x]Battlecry: Give a random Murloc in your hand +1/+1.

paladinMurloc.flavor: Theme song by Ellie Goldfin and Blagghghlrlrl Harris.
paladinMurloc.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
paladinMurloc.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
paladinMurloc.name: Anyfin Can Happen
paladinMurloc.text: Summon 7 Murlocs that died this game.

paladinMurloc.flavor: "The sands shall be my sea! And this scarab shall be my, er, strange and wriggly boat!"
paladinMurloc.name: Sir Finley of the Sands
paladinMurloc.text: [x]Battlecry: If your deck has no duplicates, Discover an upgraded Hero Power.

paladinMurloc.flavor: Murloc hydrologists are pretty rare.  Most murloc undergrads pick computer science.
paladinMurloc.name: Hydrologist

paladinMurloc.flavor: Sure, he'll return your stuff.  OVER HIS DEAD BODY!
paladinMurloc.name: Primalfin Champion
paladinMurloc.text: [x]Deathrattle: Return any spells you cast on this minion to your hand.

paladinMurloc.flavor: It's about what they have in common, not what makes them different.
paladinMurloc.name: Scalelord

paladinMurloc.flavor: Return my fishes to me, and I myself shall carry you to the gates of Mrrhalla!
paladinMurloc.name: Felfin Navigator

paladinMurloc.flavor: Mrrraggglhlhghghlgh, mrgaaag blarrghlgaahahl mrgggg glhalhah a bghhll graggmgmg Garrosh mglhlhlh mrghlhlhl!!
paladinMurloc.name: Murloc Raider

paladinMurloc.flavor: He just wants a hug.   A sloppy... slimy... hug.
paladinMurloc.name: Bluegill Warrior

paladinMurloc.flavor: "Death will rise, from the tides!"
paladinMurloc.name: Murloc Tidehunter

paladinMurloc.flavor: These are the brainy murlocs.  It turns out that doesn’t mean much.
paladinMurloc.name: Grimscale Oracle

paladinMurloc.flavor: Be all that you can be.
paladinMurloc.name: Nightmare Amalgam
paladinMurloc.text: [x]This is an Elemental, Mech, Demon, Murloc, Dragon, Beast, Pirate and Totem.

paladinMurloc.flavor: His favorite spell is Chum Explosion.
paladinMurloc.name: Deadscale Knight

paladinMurloc.flavor: The Murloc is taking the picture.
paladinMurloc.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
paladinMurloc.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
paladinMurloc.name: Zoobot
paladinMurloc.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly Beast, Dragon, and Murloc +1/+1.

paladinMurloc.flavor: Just between us, if things get tight the Menagerie Magician position will probably be the first to go.
paladinMurloc.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
paladinMurloc.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
paladinMurloc.name: Menagerie Magician
paladinMurloc.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly Beast, Dragon, and Murloc +2/+2.

paladinMurloc.flavor: The scent of fish lingers on the fishflinger's fish fingers.
paladinMurloc.name: Fishflinger
paladinMurloc.text: Battlecry: Add a random Murloc to each player's hand.

paladinHeal.flavor: Just could not be talked out of using his turtle for the joust...
paladinHeal.name: Tuskarr Jouster
paladinHeal.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, restore #7 Health to your hero.

paladinHeal.flavor: "Think you got lethal? Libram of NOPE!"

 The weak succumbed, their souls devoured.

rogueCombo.flavor: He needed a break after that business in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms. Naturally, he chose to spend his vacation in an icy snowscape killing monsters.

Give +3 Attack and
Immune this turn.

roguePoison.flavor: Eight times the death of regular-mancers.

rogueSecret.flavor: What will she destroy? It’s a secret!

shamanMurloc.flavor: In addition to fluent Common, he also speaks fourteen dialects of 'mrgl'.

shamanMurloc.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.

shamanMurloc.flavor: Bile actually makes for surprisingly sturdy fins.

shamanTotem.flavor: You can usually find these at the totemist's market on Saturdays.

shamanTotem.flavor: To truly understand candles, it takes YEARS of quiet contemplation.

At the end of your turn,

shamanTransform.flavor: Finally, Electra can work from home.

Transform a friendly minion into
one that costs (1) more. Repeatable this turn.

shamanTransform.flavor: Let's give a big hand for goblin experimentation!

shamanTransform.text: [x]Battlecry: Transform another random minion into a 5/5 Devilsaur or a 1/1 Squirrel.

shamanWindfury.flavor: Windfury is like Earthfury and Firefury, but more light and airy.

Enhance-o Mechano

shamanWindfury.flavor: They say that "grotesque is in the eye of the beholder," but that's just because they've never seen a Grotesque Dragonhawk. Yikes!

shamanFreeze.name: Frost Shock

"What do we want?" "CHAOS!"
 "When do we want it?"
 "WHEN LEAST EXPECTED!"

demonhunterDemon.text: Rush. After this attacks and kills a minion, it may attack again.

demonhunterDemon.flavor: Yet, you still feel attacked.

demonhunterDemon.text: Can't attack heroes.
